title: Alex Brummer for the Daily Mail
text: Caretaker manager Noel Quinn looks to be making all the right noises about putting some zip back into performance, and is being allowed to hunker down and get on with the job. In Europe HSBC has been constrained by UK ring-fencing of domestic banking, a subscale bank in France and a misfiring private bank in Geneva that brought all sorts of grief. Quinn is approaching the problem by cutting jobs and refocusing on growth markets in the Middle East and Pacific. He needs to convince investors there is more to Asia than Hong Kong, its principal market, and that it is well placed to take advantage. ...read
